issues.title: Circular Dependencies Between PIT and WRAC
issues.description: Circular dependency detected: WRAC depends on PIT, and PIT depends on WRAC. This creates a build sequencing issue and indicates tight coupling.
issues.root_cause: Direct module-to-module dependencies instead of event-driven integration

resolution.approach: Redesign integration to use event-driven architecture
steps: Define integration events between PIT and WRAC
Create event bus for inter-module communication

lessons_learned: Circular dependencies indicate architectural design issues
Integration contracts must be explicit and unidirectional

issues.title: Circular Dependencies Between THREAT and VULNERABILITY
issues.description: Circular dependency detected: THREAT depends on VULNERABILITY, and VULNERABILITY depends on THREAT. Security concepts are tightly coupled.
issues.root_cause: Shared data models and synchronous cross-module calls

resolution.approach: Separate concerns with clear boundaries and async communication
steps: Define clear separation of THREAT and VULNERABILITY concepts
Create independent data models with shared reference types

lessons_learned: Related concepts don't require direct dependencies

issues.title: Missing Readiness Reports for 4 Modules
issues.detected_during: Build Wave 1 Planning - Module Readiness Check
issues.description: Four modules (POLICY_BUILDER, ANALYTICS_REMOTE_ASSURANCE, AUDITOR_MOBILE_APP, SKILLS_DEVELOPMENT_PORTAL) had no readiness reports, blocking automated planning.
issues.root_cause: Modules added to Wave 1 without completing readiness assessment process

resolution.approach: Generated placeholder readiness reports with 0% completeness

lessons_learned: All modules must have readiness reports before planning
Readiness assessment is a prerequisite, not optional
Placeholder reports enable planning to proceed
issues.prevention: Add validation gate: require readiness reports before adding modules to build wave

issues.title: All Modules at 0% Architecture Completeness
issues.description: All 11 modules have 0% or very low architecture completeness (average 0%). This blocks full implementation builds.
issues.root_cause: Architecture documentation incomplete across all Wave 1 modules

resolution.approach: Proceed with skeleton builds; defer full implementation to Wave 2
steps: Generate skeleton builds for all modules
Create Change Records for each module's gaps
resolution.when_to_apply: Wave 1 skeleton builds, Wave 2 full builds

lessons_learned: Skeleton builds are valid when architecture is incomplete
Architecture-first approach is critical for quality
Change Records enable tracking of technical debt
issues.prevention: Set minimum 80% completeness threshold for full builds

issues.title: Dependency Graph Validation Needed
issues.description: Dependency graph had circular dependencies that weren't caught during architecture design phase. Validation must be earlier in process.
issues.root_cause: No automated dependency validation during architecture phase

resolution.approach: Add circular dependency detection to architecture validation checklist

lessons_learned: Circular dependencies should be caught in architecture phase
issues.prevention: Add dependency validation to architecture review process

key_themes: Circular dependencies indicate architecture design issues
Event-driven architecture is critical for module integration
Process gates (readiness reports) must be enforced
Skeleton builds enable progress when architecture is incomplete
Validation must happen earlier in the process
recommendations: Add circular dependency detection to architecture validation
Require readiness reports before including modules in builds
Implement event-driven integration for all cross-module communication
Set minimum architecture completeness threshold (80%) for full builds
Create automated validation tools for architecture phase
